programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job S1 (7/8)
programme.desc: Amanda and Alan's plans to create an open-plan living and dining room run into trouble.

programme.title: We need to talk about Cosby S1 (2/4)
programme.desc: In the 1970s, Bill Cosby is on a path to becoming an educator and moral authority.

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo (Tout pour Diego) S1 (2/3)
programme.desc: «Tout pour Diego»Now married and living in 1930s America, Frida sees the ugly side of capitalism.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S23 (41/55)
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer escape her small flat near Heathrow airport.

programme.title: The Bidding Room S4 (18/30)
programme.desc: Five dealers bid to buy an Evel Knievel doll, a 1960s Triang desk and a six-foot tuna.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer. Carol Klein visits Colesbourne Gardens in Gloucestershire to revel in their vibrant displays of spring colour. There's also a skateboarding gardener who has created a haven for wildlife - and herself - in her forest garden in Sheffield. At RHS Hyde Hall in Essex, Adam Frost discovers which plants will be best suited to the changing climate. Also, there's the remarkable story of a family who bought a botanic garden in Scotland on impulse, and more of the films that have been sent in by viewers.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain (Carlisle) (n°15)
programme.desc: «Carlisle»The duo discover an astonishing scheme in a Carlisle pub.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a general knowledge quiz featuring the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: Gymnastique artistique : Championnats d'Europe féminin
programme.desc: Matt Baker introduces live coverage from Turkey as the finalists perform routines marrying grace and strength in a bid to be recognised as Europe's best all-around female gymnast. Great Britain has enjoyed medal success in this four-apparatus event in the recent past, with Alice Kinsella winning silver behind Italy's Asia D'Amato last summer and Jessica Gadirova earning bronze in 2021.

programme.title: Natural World (Orangutans - The Great Ape Escape) S34 (6/10)
programme.desc: «Orangutans - The Great Ape Escape»Following Leonora, a pioneering orangutan on an important mission back into the wild.

programme.title: My Unique B&B (Rebecca and Ralph's Bender) S2 (15/15)
programme.desc: «Rebecca and Ralph's Bender»Simon and team are in Dorset to build a unique and very colorful B&B.

programme.title: Flog It ! S16
programme.desc: A special edition of Flog it! from all over the UK, travelling up and down the country revisiting some of the historic venues from the series and bringing brand new valuations and unexpected auctions. Paul Martin goes behind the scenes of Bamburgh to see just what it takes to keep a castle alive.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games decanter, or will they be tempted by the House of Games kitchen composter?

programme.title: B&B By the Sea (Ugo Monye) S1 (5/15)
programme.desc: «Ugo Monye»It's the turn of rugby star and presenter Ugo Monye to check into the B&B by the sea.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands S1 (2/4)
programme.desc: Iolo Williams discovers the amazing wildlife of Radnorshire in the Welsh Marches.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Calum Clunie provide more gardening tips and advice from Beechgrove Garden. It's a busy time in the garden, with sowing and planting taking place for the approaching summer. The year's first early potatoes get started, and there is a trial of tomato plants suited to windowsill growing. Calum checks on the progress of the variety of supermarket bulbs he bought last year, and Kirsty Wilson starts the first in her series by looking at the selection, care and display of houseplants. And George Anderson provides the first update from his allotment in Joppa.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty prepares for late spring and summer, sowing poppies and planting cornflowers for colour and interest in the Paradise Garden. He also harvests rhubarb and shares tips on moving shrubs. Toby Buckland revels in some fabulous spring planting on a visit to the magnificent landscaped gardens of Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a passionate dahlia grower who was once a florist working at the White House for the Obamas. Plus more of the films that have been sent in by viewers.

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago S5 (2/3)
programme.desc: With less than a week to go, the pilgrims decide to speed up their journey.

programme.title: Cunk on Britain (The Third Episode) S1 (3/5)
programme.desc: «The Third Episode»The journey up Britain's history continues with a look at the Victorian era. Written by Charlie Brooker and starring Diane Morgan. With guests including Chris Packham.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team bring you more Premier League lifestyle and culture.

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders (The Show Must Go On) S1 (3/4)
programme.desc: «The Show Must Go On»The NYPD investigate multiple leads into the murder of Nick De Noia.
